content: "What if it was 'Oh, the gay one,' or 'Oh, the Asian kid?' " asks Maggie Kwok, head of the Penn State Veterans Organization in an interview with the Daily Collegian, PSU's student newspaper. She is referring to a "training video," prepared by the university's Counseling and Psychological Services office, depicting "worrisome student behavior." The Video is here: ++http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vhLq9NPLv0M++ Leave it to higher education to come up with this garbage.

content: Well, I can see it doesn't belong here. However, as a long time senior college instructor in a military college program on two large military bases I can understand the young female instructor's concern. Some students will "bully" instructors and make similar threats (but it is nearly impossible to get an instructor fired.) Students can get kicked out of college for doing that. Is your concern that the young man depicted is a veteran? I don't think veteran's have a monopoly on being obnoxious. BTW, females seem to be more confrontational about grades than males, but that's just my observation. I'd assume Penn State has had similar problems?? I suppose this is a training video for newer instructors, similar sounding literature appears in many college 'instructors handbooks'. What do you see is going on in the video, athos20? This message has been edited. Last edited by: reducetension, Sat 11 April 2009 08:49 PM

I'll bet more educated and informed Veterans are hitting the campus and not taking the general opinion of the professors and leaving it at that. It seems that they are looking for an avenue to remove the Veteran if that Vet forms a differing opinion. It has been widely known for many years that the college campus is not exactly the friendliest atmosphere for a Veteran Male or Female. I'm glad that our freedom of expression, the right to assemble, Free Speech are all protected by the constitution. It makes it easier for the Veteran to explain there position without being roasted and silenced. Veterans are the witness to what really happened and the so called "High Educators" can't tell you something that didn't happen if you were there. If your a Veteran on a Campus somewhere in this country then hold your head high because you were serving your country when the majority of dirtbags surrounding you were playing HALO, raiding Mom and Dad's Fridge for Twinkies, Yougurt tubes and cookies and living high on the Family TiT. content: Well, the video leaves us hanging a bit. What was supposed to be the resson for the video? If it was supposed to show how a professor or teacher should handle a problem student, they didn't do a very good job at it. And the choice of using a veteran just goes in hand with academia's low opinion of those who serve. At leaset that is my observation in my adult life. While my interaction of civilian classes offered on base were good one, the classes on campus had a decidedly different tone.

content: Absolutely sux! After getting out of the Army (1973) and welding for two years, I decided to go to college at a fairly conservative University on the GI Bill. I was standing in line in my tankers jacket, waiting to draw class cards (This was before computers - ), and I realize some gent in a suit is standing at my elbow. He says, "Son, you need a haircut, and that jacket doesn't go around here." I turned, looked him right in the eye, and said in my best,low, but about to explode Sergeant's voice, "I earned this jacket by 3 years of people harping about haircuts." Then I just continued to stair at him until he moved on. So it goes...coming back to the World is not necessarily coming back to the Planet... Looks like the more things "change", the more they stay the same - - Wandering and Wondering

content: Academia Elitists - mostly very left-leaning liberal - have an agenda for reshaping this country in their own image that they have been pursuing for decades. They really got their meat-hooks into the country during the "Anti-Establishment" Era of Post-Vietnam. They have demonized Patriotism, Americanization, Assimilation, the military and the married white American male to the point that all are considered hackneyed dead anachronisms of an even deader past by almost everyone today. Even as you read the list, didn't you internally cringe a little? If you watched the video this thread is based on, notice the stereo-type. Why is the teacher a young female? Why isn't the Veteran student a young black woman, or Mexican, or a Puerto Rican, or Asian, or black man?? What you are watching is harsh reverse bigotry of the worst kind, profiling the young white male as a threat, a danger to the school. Yet no one dare call it what it is, for fear of being screamed down as a supporter of the Aryan Nation or KKK. Do you see how programed we have become?? From "Archie Bunker" (A nutty Korean War Veteran) through "MASH", "Married with Children" and "The Simpsons" we have been so thoroughly programed to denigrate anything a white male, especially a Veteran, might say, do, or be thinking. That, as much as anything, is why John McCain was doomed from the beginning when he decided to run for office. Without knowing it, most people were subtly thinking, "He may mean well, but he's one of those wacky-thinking, wounded-brained, way-too white looking, weird Veterans. Best not put him in charge, or BOOM!" Yup, their agenda is working pretty well, especially if you are thinking of me right now as "one of those wacky-thinking, wounded-brained, way-too white looking, weird Veterans." Wandering and Wondering

With colorful ideas and by making "LAZY" profitable they have garnered more than half of the popular vote by giving what we don't have to the laziest people in our country. Ain't it ironically funny how the Laziest people seem to be on either end of the spectrum. The Extremely wealthy have everything done for them and usually are getting way too much for what they do, do and the really poor just sit, get fat and enjoy their "benefits". In the middle are the "paying" customers getting scrood and then on top of that we are divided on some really stoopid issues. They have almost gotten us to a division point where an ignition could occur. While you contemplate that some insurance company is running a program to determine what you will be able to bear in the form of insurance premiums for some item that used to be guaranteed to not break. Try that website named after that guy Craig and see if you can barter your way through a sweet deal and keep uncle obama out of the deal.
